page.title: 20THE HEADLESS CORPSE.
page.content: Chilton Cantelo has a wordwide and rather macabre claim to fame. A man called Theophilus Broome was a Roundhead during the Civil War in the 17th century. He was wounded in a battle between the Roundheads and Cavaliers which took place on Babylon Hill near Yeovil. Although wounded he managed to get to his sister's house, Higher Farm, Chilton Cantelo. Before he died he made a strange request. He asked his brother-in-law to cut off his head after his death and keep it forever in the house where it still remains. His body is buried in the only grave in the church. There are various legends concerning the attempts to bury the head with the body and it is said that when the skull is disturbed the effects can be disastrous. The villagers like to ensure the skulls peace.
